Sequence Information.Peptide Name: dPSMα4 (PSMα4 peptide derivative; bacteriocin; staphylococcus aureus, bacteria)
Sequence Information.Source: Truncated the peptide PSMα4 (from Staphylococcus aureus)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the phenol-soluble modulin alpha peptides family.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.22371493]Gram-positive bacteria:Streptococcus serotype GAS M3 strain 4041-05 (MIC=10 μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22371493]52% hemolysis at 10μg/mL against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria. Peptide which can recruit, activate and subsequently lyse human neutrophils, thus eliminating the main cellular defense against infection. Stimulates the secretion of the chemotactic factor interleukin-8 (IL-8). The ensuing activation process triggers an inflammatory response in the host, thus contributing greatly to virulence. Also possesses hemolytic activity, which may contribute to the development of disease. Peptide production is higher in most prevalent community-associated MRSA strains than in hospital-associated MRSA strains.

Literature.Title: Novel phenol-soluble modulin derivatives in community-associated methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus identified through imaging mass spectrometry.
Literature.Author: Gonzalez DJ, Okumura CY, Hollands A, Kersten R, Akong-Moore K, Pence MA, Malone CL, Derieux J, Moore BS, Horswill AR, Dixon JE, Dorrestein PC, Nizet V.
